trans-unit.source: Learn how to require MFA (multi-factor authentication) for privileged identities with the Azure Privileged Identity Management extension.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to require MFA (multi-factor authentication) for privileged identities with the Azure Privileged Identity Management extension.

trans-unit.source: Azure Privileged Identity Management: How To How To Require MFA
trans-unit.target: Azure Privileged Identity Management: How To How To Require MFA

trans-unit.source: It is highly recommended that you require multi-factor authentication for all of your administrators.
trans-unit.target: It is highly recommended that you require multi-factor authentication for all of your administrators.

trans-unit.source: Requiring MFA in Azure Privileged Identity Management
trans-unit.target: Requiring MFA in Azure Privileged Identity Management

trans-unit.source: When you log in as a PIM administrator, you will receive alerts that suggest that your privileged accounts should require multi-factor authentication (MFA).
trans-unit.target: When you log in as a PIM administrator, you will receive alerts that suggest that your privileged accounts should require multi-factor authentication (MFA).

trans-unit.source: Click the security alert in the PIM dashboard and a new blade will open with a list of the administrator accounts that should require MFA.
trans-unit.target: Click the security alert in the PIM dashboard and a new blade will open with a list of the administrator accounts that should require MFA.

trans-unit.source: You can require MFA by selecting multiple roles and then clicking the Fix button, or you can click the ellipses next to individual roles and then click the Fix button.
trans-unit.target: You can require MFA by selecting multiple roles and then clicking the Fix button, or you can click the ellipses next to individual roles and then click the Fix button.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can change the MFA requirement by role by clicking on a role in the Roles section of the dashboard, then enabling MFA for that role by clicking on Settings in the role blade and then selecting Enable under multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can change the MFA requirement by role by clicking on a role in the Roles section of the dashboard, then enabling MFA for that role by clicking on Settings in the role blade and then selecting Enable under multi-factor authentication.
